title: Patch 5.13, discussion about Hextech gunblade on Vladimir as well as WoA
body: Now that Will of the Anicents doesn't give spellvamp, it is possible to buy hextech gun blade and take advantage of both spellvamp effects, that coupled with spellvamp quints and a spirit visage would make vlad a spellvamping machine, now i play vlad a lot and i know how useless the AD and life steal would be on him, so i want to know if you guys think that its worth buying the item for its active, decent AP and spellvamp, or if the expense/useing up and item slot for so many wasted stats outweighs the insane spell vamping.

replies.body:
I think your misrepresenting the reason you would get a WoTA over a hextech in the first place (gold cost is cheaper AND CDR is the better stat) which now that they have seperate spell vamps means that Hextech isn't a bad item, the main reason it was, was because they couldn't stack, and putting the extra gold down was a waste when your losing a major stat (CDR)

Sure the AD/Lifesteal isn't amazing, but it's not terrible either, that coupled with the passive being something that Vlad could defintely use before he gets a Rylai's (if that's his intended item).

But it would probably be a Niche item on a Vlad either way and probably something that would be better to complete after a Spirit Visage if your in top lane, as it's not really something you'd want on a mid lane vlad.

Gunblade costs a lot :/ If you're just after the healing then spirit visage should work but unless you're really really fed i dont think you should be buying a gunblade as vlad..

Then again, the active on gunblade is actually really damn good seeing as how i miss out on like half my kills because my enemies outrun me unless I build lots of movement speed
Ok i just tried it and its very powerful haha

Well, it's no longer the same unique passive so, theoretically, the spellvamp from Hextech Gunblade and Will of the Ancients should stack *unless* Riot have made it so they wont stack even though they no longer share the same unique passive.
